Topic.Title: Looking for graphic adventures in the style of level 9

Posts.EditableText: Hi everyone.  I am an older gamer, to give you an indication of how old, I made my first graphic adventure on the rubber keyed spectrum 48k using a tool called GAC (Graphic Adventure Creator).  Anyway, I was curious if there are any games here that are on the 8 bit category, or even better, the 16 bit era as I missed must of those and the graphics and parsars were much better.  I think there was a game called Gnome which I have always wanted to try, and Jinxster etc.  Any graphic adventures that invoke the nostaslgia of those days and include graphics and sound would spark my interest.  Thanks in advance to anyone that can help.  Btw I used to have a Commodore Amiga 500 which a lot of those games were on.  I don't want to go down the rom route either.

Hi Majestico!

Coincidentally, we're about to start work on the remaster of _Jinxter_. Realistically, this will take a few months, although a beta could be sooner.

We've already released [_The Pawn_](https://strandgames.com/games/thepawn) and [_The Guild of Thieves_](https://strandgames.com/games/theguild), for all major platforms; Windows, OSX, Linux, Android and iOS.

Some of the games are getting enhancements and improvements over the original, which is pretty cool.

Check out [Strand Games](https://strandgames.com).

The other guy is spam, I think.

This site only has text adventures. There is one guy that was able to make a variant of Space Invaders for the desktop, and there are plenty of games on here that try to give off that old text adventure feel, but besides that there isn't much that fits your description. I'd recommend searching other places.
